result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zacharia D. Martin

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Zacharia D. Martin in court.  Attorney Anthony N Flitcroft in court for Zacharia D. Martin.  Attorney JJ Crawford in court for State of Wisconsin. Charges and penalties explained. Not guilty plea entered by counsel and speedy trial reserved. Scheduling order to go out via e-filing. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Notice to Person Posting Bond Money
Cash bond filed. Defendant refused to sign bond.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH B.J.C. dob 10-29-1986 or RESIDENCE. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Zacharia D Martin in court, in custody by video. Vivien TenHaken appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Josh Ryan for defendant. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Possible felony charges coming. Cash bond set. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
